intro: [WRONG START] Cattleya labiata var. Bella, commonly known as the Bella Cattleya, is a hybrid orchid prized for its vibrant, showy flowers. It features large, waxy petals and a prominent, often colorful lip that distinguishes it from other orchid varieties. This plant is native to the tropical regions of South America, where it thrives in warm, humid climates. It requires well-draining soil and bright, indirect light to flourish. Its botanical beauty makes it a popular choice among orchid enthusiasts for both its ornamental value and ease of cultivation.
